item.title: Tidbits
item.description: Make command The make command accepts targets as command line arguments. These targets are usually specified in a file named ‘Makefile’, which also contains the associated action corresponding to the targets. Splat operator This feature allows you to capture a variable number of arguments to a function, combined with “normal” arguments passed in if you like. It’s easiest to see with an example: function concatenate($transform, ...$strings) { $string = ''; foreach($strings as $piece) { $string .
